quotes.quote: When the law no longer protects you from the corrupt, but protects the corrupt from you, you know your nation is doomed.
Human beings are born with different capacities. If they are free, they are not equal. And if they are equal, they are not free.
For me, socialism has always been about liberty and solidarity, but also about responsibility.
Socialism values equality more than liberty.
Socialism is also unselfishness embraced as an axiom.
Socialism requires that government becomes your god.
Socialism is the abolition of human self-alienation, the return of man as a real human being.
Socialism is simply Communism for people without the testosterone to man the barricades.
No one has the right to place one human being in a position of political power over another.
Socialism is a philosophy of failure, the creed of ignorance, and the gospel of envy, its inherent virtue is the equal sharing of misery.
Socialism, on the contrary, extends its function to the description of society as it should be, and the discovery of the means of making it what it should be.
The goal of socialism is communism.
It is not what you can do for your country, but what you can do for all of mankind.
Socialism in general has a record of failure so blatant that only an intellectual could ignore or evade it.
We are now moving towards complete collectivism or socialism, a system under which everybody is enslaved to everybody.
When we give government the power to make medical decisions for us, we in essence accept that the state owns our bodies.
The problem with socialism is that eventually you run out of other people's money.
Socialism is like a dream. Sooner or later you wake up to reality.
Socialism is not a science, a sociology in miniature: it is a cry of pain.
Socialism is politicized envy.
Socialism is the ideal state, but it can never be achieved while man is so selfish.
Socialism always produces evil results, no matter one's intentions.
Socialism is nothing but the capitalism of the lower classes.
Socialism, as I understand it, is a system of democracy. Without democracy, there is no socialism.
Socialism is socialism. Government run enterprises are just as inept under democratic governments as they are under autocratic governments.
Socialism is the religion people get when they lose their religion.
The function of socialism is to raise suffering to a higher level.
Socialism proposes no adequate substitute for the motive of enlightened selfishness that today is at the basis of all human labor and effort, enterprise and new activity.
A society that chooses between capitalism and socialism does not choose between two social systems; it chooses between social cooperation and the disintegration of society.
Socialism is practical, in the best sense of the term; a living, vital force of inestimable value to society.
